title: Game of Life

fit_field.title: Fit the game field into the client area and restart

gi_h2-3: Watch primitive cells evolve in their primitive universe
gi_txt01: The famous Game of Life is a cellular automaton invented in 1970 by John Horton Conway - the British mathematician.
gi_txt02: It is a zero-player game - the initial state fully determines the game evolution. No further input is required.
gi_txt03: Nevertheless, the game realization includes advanced controls:
gi_txt04: drag-n-drop any picture (jpeg, png) into the game field to see it evolve;
gi_txt05: use the mouse wheel to scale the game field;
gi_txt06: click-n-move the mouse to navigate through the game field;
gi_txt08: Using a touchscreen device (smartphone or tablet) may improve your gaming experience:
gi_txt09: swipe (using 1 or 2 fingers) to navigate through the game field;
gi_txt10: pinch/expand using 2 fingers to scale the game field.
gi_txt11: Switch to edit mode and use your mouse or touchscreen to:
gi_txt16: - evolve once (single tap) or continuously (tap-and-move), try when paused.
gi_txt17: The sliders button is located in the lowest right corner and opens additional parameters:
gi_txt18: - the HUD info switch, which displays the current game information;
gi_txt19: - the Save and Load buttons, you may save your current game state as an image and choose any picture (jpeg, png) to load - the game will interpret its pixels as dead or alive cells dependent on their brightness;
gi_txt20: - these sliders allow you to scale the field, change sound volume and evolution speed.
gi_txt23: - evolve manually by a single click;
gi_txt24: - expand/compress the game area by hiding/showing menu bars;
gi_txt25: - reveal the menu (this button appears in the top right corner when the game area is expanded);
gi_txt27: - resize the game field to fit the available area and spawn cells randomly.
gi_txt30: - settings button, where you can manually set game field size, cells spawn probability, evolution speed slider limits;
gi_txt31: - sound mute switch, full window expand/compress switch, Day/Night mode switch.
